001package gbw.melange.common.elementary.contraints;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Quaternion;
004
005/**
006 * <p>IComputedTransforms interface.</p>
007 *
008 * @author GustavBW
009 * @version $Id: $Id
010 */
011public interface IComputedTransforms {
012    /**
013     * Updates the internal state of the transforms. This should be called after any changes to the matrix.
014     */
015    void update();
016    /**
017     * Relative to screen space dimensions, in the range of -1 to 1
018     *
019     * @return a double
020     */
021    double getHeight();
022    /**
023     * Relative to screen space dimensions, in the range of -1 to 1
024     *
025     * @return a double
026     */
027    double getWidth();
028    /**
029     * Relative to screen space dimensions, in the range of -1 to 1
030     *
031     * @return a double
032     */
033    double getPositionX();
034    /**
035     * Returns the axis aligned bounds of the element in the form of a double array.
036     * The array is in the form of: [x, y, width, height] disregards rotation and is not necessarily the exact extends of the mesh.
037     */
038    double[] getAxisAlignedBounds();
039
040    /**
041     * Relative to screen space dimensions, in the range of -1 to 1
042     *
043     * @return a double
044     */
045    double getPositionY();
046    //TODO: Find a way to simplify this. I don't understand it either, but know its how rotation works in 3D
047    /**
048     * <p>getRotation.</p>
049     *
050     * @return a {@link com.badlogic.gdx.math.Quaternion} object
051     */
052    Quaternion getRotation();
053}
